refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This file specifies configuration options for various components of the 3G Bridge suite.

The configuration file is organized into groups. Every group must start with the group name enclosed in square brackets. Inside a group there can be any number of key-value pairs specifying various options. Lines starting with a # are treated as comments and are ignored.

There are a number of sections, described below, that contain options for specific components of the 3G Bridge suite. If a group is not one of these, then it defines a target grid system where jobs can be sent.

The pre-defined group names are:
database: Database access parameters
defaults: Global defaults
bridge: Specific options for 3g-bridge
wssubmitter: Specific options for wssubmitter

refsect1.title: DATABASE ACCESS PARAMETERS
refsect1.para: The following values can be configured in the database group:

glossdef.para: The name of the MySQL database to use.
User name to use when connecting to the database. Defaults to the name of the current user.
The name of the host where the database is. Defaults to localhost.
Password for authenticating to the database.

Max. number of simultaneous database connections. Setting it too low may cause deadlocks; setting it high usually does not cause any harm. The 3g-bridge requires this limit to be at least 4; for the wssubmitter, it is recommended to set this limit to 1.5 times the number of download plus service threads.

refsect1.title: GLOBAL DEFAULTS
refsect1.para: The following values can be configured in the defaults group. The same values can also be listed in the bridge and wssubmitter groups, in this case the values specified there override the defaults.

glossdef.para: Specifies the minimun severity of a message to be logged. The value must be one of (in increasing severity order): debug, info, notice, warning, error and crit. The value is not case-sensitive.

Specifies where to send log messages. Possible values:
stdout: send all messages to the standard output.
syslog: send all messages to the system log. You can also specify the syslog facility after a colon, e.g.: syslog:user. The default facility is daemon.
file:FILE: write all messages to the specified FILE.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR 3G-BRIDGE
refsect1.para: The following values can be specified in the bridge group:

glossdef.para: Location of the pid file. When running as a daemon, the 3g-bridge stores its process ID in this file.
Time to sleep between polls of the database watching for new jobs.
Minimum time between status updates of the grid plugins.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR WSSUBMITTER
refsect1.para: The following values can be specified in the wssubmitter group:

glossdef.para: Location of the pid file. When running as a daemon, the wssubmitter stores its process ID in this file.
Network port where wssubmitter should listen on.
Number of threads to launch for servicing requests.
Number of threads to launch for downloading the input files of submitted jobs.
Directory where the input files of submitted jobs are stored.
Directory where to store the generated output files of finished jobs.

URL prefix for downloading the output files. When a remote client requests the list of output files for a specific job, wssubmitter replaces the value of output-dir in the file name with the value of output-url-prefix and reports the resulting URL. It is the responsibility of the system administrator to configure the appropriate web server such a way that the output files are really available at the resulting location.

refsect1.title: DEFINING GRID INSTANCES
refsect1.para: If the name of a group is not one of the values described above, then it defines a grid instane where jobs can be sent. The name of the group is matched with the grid name in the database to decide where to send a specific job.
Every grid definition group must contain a value for handler that decides which grid plugin will handle this definition. The group may also contain additional definitions specific to the grid plugin.
Currently the following grid plugins are available (i.e. these are the allowed values for handler), provided the support for the specified plugin is compiled into the 3g-bridge:

listitem.para: DC-API: Submit jobs using DC-API with batching support. The jobs must refer to applications that are using the genwrapper.
DC-API-SINGLE: Submit jobs using DC-API, without batching support. Any DC-API compatible applications can be submitted this way.
EGEE: Sumbit jobs to an EGEE VO using gLite.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE DC-API AND DC-API-SINGLE PLUGINS
refsect1.para: If a grid definition uses the DC-API or the DC-API-SINGLE plugin, then the following values can be specified in the defining group:

glossdef.para: Location of the config file for the DC-API. If not specified, the DC-API default is used, which is dc-api.conf in the current directory. Note that when running as a daemon, the 3g-bridge switces to the root directory, so the default value will not work, and a file with an absolute path name must be specified here.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE EGEE PLUGIN
refsect1.para: If a grid definition uses the EGEE plugin, then the following values can be specified in the defining group:

glossdef.para: URL of the WMS service.
Name of the VO (Virtual Organization) where the job should be sent.
Name of the host where MyProxy runs.
The port of the MyProxy server. Defaults to 7512.
User name used when authenticating to MyProxy.
X.509 certificate used for authenticating to MyProxy.
The private key for the certificate used for authenticating to MyProxy.
URL prefix for the input sandbox.
